page.title: 05Roepark Mow Cop
page.content: From the old man of mow the there is a footpath that run through Roepark to Akers crossing.Roepark is a wood.This is a very old wood and the trees are mainly oak and silver birch.There are also otherds.rowan,holly and beech. fern grows widespread and also grass and toadstools. The woods are private and have become smaller. In 1876 Hatchings close was covered in trees. Now there are three dying trees only. The woods are named after roe deer which was hunted in the past. There is an interesting story regarding this in the naming of the Bleeding Wolf Inn, which is situated on the A 34 at Scholar Green.
